info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:17AM EDT until April 7 at 4:11AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Blue River at Fredericksburg affecting Harrison and Washington Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Blue River at Fredericksburg.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, US 150 is closed. At 24.0 feet, Water surrounds some homes along backroads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 21.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 17.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage again tomorrow evening to 24.7 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.9 feet on 03/12/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
